verbose_text: The data presented here suggest that 1) the imprinting of genes in the Dlk1-Gtl2 locus is coordinately regulated, 2) this regulation may require the allele specific methylation of the Gtl2 DMR, 3) the presence of exogenous DNA sequences adjacent to the Gtl2 DMR prevents this methylation, and 4) decreased levels of Dlk1 may be causative for the lethality and dwarfism of the Gtl2lacZ and Gtl2Delta5'Neo paternal mutants.
